Can someone let me know if I'm organizing my tests properly to support
TDD =
and help my developers?

I'm trying to figure out the right way to organize=
 my unit tests for a
system with mulitple CVS modules.  I have a pyramid of=
 project/modules
each with their own unit tests and with a "main" project w=
hich depends
on all below.  

To Make it simple for developers to run the t=
est via cmd line or in
eclipse:
- each project should have its own 'tests' =
ant target 
- each project should have its own testAll class 


At the top =
level, I'm not sure if I should just offer an ant target
'system-tests' or =
offer both an ant target an a systemTestAll class.  

Duplication is naught=
y, but the ease of use payoff might make it worth it.

Eventually, I'll pro=
bably be moving to maven2 anyway....

Any ideas, suggestions or comments wo=
uld be welcomed.  Thanks.

--
Peter kahn
